segment.source: Data Tables
segment.target: Data Tables

segment.source: Data Tables
segment.target: Data Tables

segment.source: Data Tables
segment.target: Data Tables

segment.source: In many cases, a graph is the best way to view system activity to analyze performance.
segment.target: In many cases, a graph is the best way to view system activity to analyze performance.

segment.source: However, in some cases, a tabular view is preferable.
segment.target: However, in some cases, a tabular view is preferable.

segment.source: When you drag a graph onto the Analysis tab, it appears by itself.
segment.target: When you drag a graph onto the Analysis tab, it appears by itself.

segment.source: To view the same data in tabular form with the graph shrunk to a thumbnail, click the right-most layout icon on the graph title bar.
segment.target: To view the same data in tabular form with the graph shrunk to a thumbnail, click the right-most layout icon on the graph title bar.

segment.source: If you want to see the data table and the graph at full size, click the left-most layout icon on the graph title bar.
segment.target: If you want to see the data table and the graph at full size, click the left-most layout icon on the graph title bar.

segment.source: The following illustration shows a WPA data table.
segment.target: The following illustration shows a WPA data table.

segment.source: wpa table
segment.target: wpa table

segment.source: If you do not see the vertical gold bar when you first open a data table, scroll to the right.
segment.target: If you do not see the vertical gold bar when you first open a data table, scroll to the right.

segment.source: The Legend column on the right of the table corresponds to the Legend control to the left of the associated graph.
segment.target: The Legend column on the right of the table corresponds to the Legend control to the left of the associated graph.

segment.source: If you select one or more items in the Legend control, the corresponding rows of the table are selected, and vice versa.
segment.target: If you select one or more items in the Legend control, the corresponding rows of the table are selected, and vice versa.

segment.source: The data table and the associated graph are dynamically synchronized.
segment.target: The data table and the associated graph are dynamically synchronized.

segment.source: If you make changes to the data table, the graph reflects these changes.
segment.target: If you make changes to the data table, the graph reflects these changes.

segment.source: If you expand or collapse a node in the graph Legend control, it is also expanded or collapsed in the data table, and vice versa.
segment.target: If you expand or collapse a node in the graph Legend control, it is also expanded or collapsed in the data table, and vice versa.

segment.source: If you zoom in to a time interval on the graph, the table shows only data pertaining to the selected time interval.
segment.target: If you zoom in to a time interval on the graph, the table shows only data pertaining to the selected time interval.

segment.source: For information on making changes to a data table, see Customize a Data Table and Apply, Create, or Delete a Preset Combination of Columns to Display.
segment.target: For information on making changes to a data table, see Customize a Data Table and Apply, Create, or Delete a Preset Combination of Columns to Display.

segment.source: For information on searching and filtering data, see Search or Filter Data.
segment.target: For information on searching and filtering data, see Search or Filter Data.

segment.source: Data Table Layout
segment.target: Data Table Layout

segment.source: The left-most column is always the line-number column, and the right-most column is always the Legend column, which corresponds to the Legend control of the corresponding graph.
segment.target: The left-most column is always the line-number column, and the right-most column is always the Legend column, which corresponds to the Legend control of the corresponding graph.

segment.source: Between these two outside columns are the following areas, from left to right:
segment.target: Between these two outside columns are the following areas, from left to right:

segment.source: Key area
segment.target: Key area

segment.source: Data area
segment.target: Data area

segment.source: Graphing element area
segment.target: Graphing element area

segment.source: Key Area
segment.target: Key Area

segment.source: This is the area on the left side of the table, between the line-number column and the vertical gold bar.
segment.target: This is the area on the left side of the table, between the line-number column and the vertical gold bar.

segment.source: Drag any column in the data area to the left of the vertical gold bar to make it a key.
segment.target: Drag any column in the data area to the left of the vertical gold bar to make it a key.

segment.source: Data Area
segment.target: Data Area

segment.source: This is the area in the center of the table, between the vertical gold bar and the vertical blue bar.
segment.target: This is the area in the center of the table, between the vertical gold bar and the vertical blue bar.

segment.source: The data for columns that appear in the data area is neither grouped nor graphed.
segment.target: The data for columns that appear in the data area is neither grouped nor graphed.

segment.source: Cells in these columns are aggregated (if an aggregation for the column has been specified) when they are to the right of a group.
segment.target: Cells in these columns are aggregated (if an aggregation for the column has been specified) when they are to the right of a group.

segment.source: Cells in these columns show the data for individual rows of the table that cannot be expanded.
segment.target: Cells in these columns show the data for individual rows of the table that cannot be expanded.

segment.source: Graphing Element Area
segment.target: Graphing Element Area

segment.source: This is the area on the right side of the table, between the vertical blue bar and the Legend column.
segment.target: This is the area on the right side of the table, between the vertical blue bar and the Legend column.

segment.source: If you drag a column to this area, the data in that column generates lines or bars on the graph.
segment.target: If you drag a column to this area, the data in that column generates lines or bars on the graph.

segment.source: If the graph is a Gantt chart, each column that you move to the graphing elements area must contain only timestamp values.
segment.target: If the graph is a Gantt chart, each column that you move to the graphing elements area must contain only timestamp values.

segment.source: A mark in one of the horizontal bars in the Gantt chart represents one timestamp value.
segment.target: A mark in one of the horizontal bars in the Gantt chart represents one timestamp value.
